option.value: {"/Users/davidclair/git/ubiquitous-ss-webapp":"{\"/components.json\":\"This file appears to be a configuration file for a Next.js application that uses the Shadcn UI library. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines various settings and aliases for the project. Here\\u0027s a summary of the different sections:\\n\\n`$schema`: Specifies the schema for the configuration file, which is used by the Shadcn UI library.\\n`style`: Sets the default style for the application.\\n`rsc`: Enables the use of React Server Components.\\n`tsx`: Enables the use of TypeScript in the application.\\n`tailwind`: Configures the Tailwind CSS settings, including the location of the configuration file, the CSS file, the base color, and whether to use CSS variables.\\n`aliases`: Defines various aliases for different directories in the project, allowing for easier imports and organization.\\n`iconLibrary`: Specifies the icon library to be used in the application, in this case, Lucide.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up the basic configuration for a Next.js application that uses the Shadcn UI library and Tailwind CSS, with various settings and aliases to improve the development experience.\",\"/tailwind.config.ts\":\"This file is a Tailwind CSS configuration file that defines the styles and theme for a web application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a configuration object that specifies the following:\\n\\n`darkMode`: Enables dark mode for the application.\\n`content`: Specifies the directories where Tailwind CSS should look for content to apply styles to.\\n`theme`: Extends the default Tailwind CSS theme with custom colors, border radii, and chart colors.\\n`plugins`: Includes the `tailwindcss-animate` plugin, which provides utility classes for adding animations to elements.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up the visual styling and theme for the web application, allowing for a consistent and customized user interface.\",\"/components/Animations.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`Fade`: A React component that fades in its child elements when they come into view using the Intersection Observer API.\\n\\nThe file implements a custom React component called `Fade` that provides a fade-in animation effect for its child elements. The component uses the Intersection Observer API to detect when the child elements come into view and adds a CSS class to trigger the fade-in animation.\",\"/.eslintrc.json\":\"This file appears to be a configuration file for a Next.js project, which is a popular React framework for building server-rendered React applications. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather it specifies the configuration for the project\\u0027s linting and TypeScript setup.\\n\\nThe configuration extends the `next/core-web-vitals` and `next/typescript` presets, which provide a set of recommended rules and settings for ensuring good web performance and TypeScript support in a Next.js project.\",\"/package.json\":\"This file appears to be a `package.json` file, which is a configuration file for a Node.js project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather lists the dependencies and development dependencies for the project, as well as the scripts that can be run to start the development server, build the project, and lint the code.\\n\\nThe project is a Next.js web application, which is a React framework for building server-rendered React applications. The project uses several libraries, including `class-variance-authority`, `clsx`, `lucide-react`, `tailwind-merge`, and `tailwindcss-animate`, which provide various utilities and components for building the application.\\n\\nThe project is set up to be developed using TypeScript, and the development dependencies include the necessary type definitions for Node.js, React, and React DOM.\",\"/app/page.tsx\":\"This file is a React component that represents the homepage of a website for a software solutions company called \\\"Ubiquitous Software Solutions Inc.\\\" It includes several sections, such as a hero section, an about section, a services section, a contact section, and a footer. The file uses various components and animations to create a visually appealing and interactive user interface.\\n\\n`Home`: This is the main component that renders the entire homepage.\\n\\n`Header`: This component is likely responsible for rendering the header or navigation menu of the website.\\n\\n`Fade`: This is likely a custom animation component that fades in content as the user scrolls.\\n\\n`ServiceCard`: This component is used to render individual service cards in the services section.\",\"/components/Card.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`ServiceCard`: A React functional component that renders a card with a service title, a border class, and children content.\\n\\nThe file exports the `ServiceCard` component, which can be used in a React application to display a service card with customizable border styles and content.\",\"/app/layout.tsx\":\"This file is the root layout component for a Next.js application. It sets up the HTML structure, imports the necessary CSS and font, and provides metadata for the application.\\n\\n`metadata`: Defines the title and description of the application.\\n\\n`RootLayout`: Renders the HTML structure for the application, including the `\\u003chtml\\u003e`, `\\u003chead\\u003e`, and `\\u003cbody\\u003e` elements, and applies the `Inter` font to the body.\",\"/components/Header.tsx\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`Header`: This function renders a header component with a logo, navigation links, and a mobile-friendly menu toggle.\\n\\n`useState`: This is a React hook that allows the component to manage state and toggle the mobile menu.\\n\\n`Image`: This is a Next.js component that optimizes the rendering of an image.\\n\\nOverall, this file defines a reusable header component for a website, with a responsive design that adapts to different screen sizes.\",\"/package-lock.json\":\"This file appears to be a package.json file for a Next.js application called \\\"ubiquitous-ss-webapp\\\". It lists the dependencies and devDependencies for the project, including libraries like \\\"class-variance-authority\\\", \\\"clsx\\\", \\\"lucide-react\\\", \\\"tailwind-merge\\\", and \\\"tailwindcss-animate\\\". The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather serves as a configuration file for the project\\u0027s dependencies and development environment.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a documentation file for a Next.js-based single static page website. The file provides an overview of the website\\u0027s features, a list of tasks to be completed, and instructions for running the website locally. The main purpose of this file is to provide information about the project and guide the development process.\",\"/app/globals.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS file that sets up a basic color scheme and a fade-in animation for a web page. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines CSS variables and styles.\\n\\n`:root`: Defines CSS variables for the color scheme, including foreground and background colors, as well as specific color values.\\n\\n`body`: Applies a linear gradient background to the body element, using the color variables defined in the `:root` selector.\\n\\n`.fade-in`: Defines a CSS animation that fades in an element with a smooth transition.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up a consistent color scheme and a simple fade-in animation that can be used throughout the web page.\",\"/lib/utils.ts\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It exports a single function:\\n\\n`cn`: A utility function that merges multiple class values using the `clsx` and `tailwind-merge` libraries, providing a concise way to conditionally apply CSS classes.\",\"/tsconfig.json\":\"This file appears to be a TypeScript configuration file for a Next.js project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a set of compiler options and include/exclude directives for the TypeScript compiler.\\n\\nThe main purpose of this file is to configure the TypeScript compiler settings for the Next.js project, including:\\n\\n- Specifying the target environment (DOM and ECMAScript Next)\\n- Allowing JavaScript files to be included\\n- Enabling strict type checking\\n- Disabling JavaScript output generation\\n- Enabling ECMAScript module interoperability\\n- Setting the module resolution strategy to use a bundler\\n- Resolving JSON modules\\n- Enabling isolated module compilation\\n- Preserving JSX syntax\\n- Enabling incremental compilation\\n- Adding a Next.js-specific plugin\\n- Defining path aliases for the project\\n\\nThe file also includes the directories and files that should be included or excluded from the TypeScript compilation process.\"}"}
